title: Unable to connect to server
body:
Hey guys, so i have just got NBN installed at my house in the past 3 weeks or so and ever since then, league of legends has stopped working. 

I can login and get as far as champion select, before the screen goes black in loading and an error message shows saying: "Unable to connect to the server. Please check your network connection and attempt to reconnect to your game." So i checked if my internet was working properly, and it is. Everything works smoothly except for league of legends. So i went on Riot's support page and went through all possible fixes to the problems, but nothing as been successful. It seems as though my router doesn't connect to the server properly, so while the technicians were at my house, i got them to look at the issue to see if they could find a way around it. They couldn't find the issue, and tried opening a number of ports required to connect to League of Legends, but with no success. I have since contacted riot and asked for some help, however none of the solutions they offered seemed to work either. I'm really stuck at the moment, i have trawled through numbers of google pages trying to see if anyone else has had a similar issue, but i haven't found anything. I might add that i am a Mac user, using the latest version of OS X. I have uninstalled, repaired the client, tried setting a static ip, tried changing the DNS settings, basically anything i found on the internet thus far. Please, let me know if anyone else is having a similar for Mac, I'm getting pretty impatient.

TL;DR  error message, tried everything, need solution, any help out there?

Here's the error: https://gyazo.com/851a1e08b50613e194f50fe3cba17dd5

{{champion:150}}  Sincerely, Gnar Mate {{champion:150}}
